snippet: The discovery of secret documents from the military dictatorship that led Argentina from 1976 to 1983 provides rare insight into the persecution of intellectual figures.
abstract: Argentina's government has found a trove of secret documents from the military dictatorship that held power in the country from 1976 to 1983; discovery provides rare insight into the persecution of intellectual figures and efforts to deal with inquiries into human rights abuses during the Dirty War, when as many as 30,000 people are thought to have been killed or disappeared.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and JONATHAN GILBERT
byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from Rio de Janeiro, and Jonathan Gilbert from Buenos Aires.

lead_paragraph: The discovery of secret documents from the military dictatorship that led Argentina from 1976 to 1983 provides rare insight into the persecution of intellectual figures.

headline.main: Argentina Finds a Dictatorship’s Secret Records
headline.print_headline: Argentina Discovers Paper Trail To Brutal Era
